measure.name: residential_misc_electric_loads
measure.description: Adds (or replaces) residential plug loads with the specified efficiency and schedule in all finished spaces. For multifamily buildings, the plug loads can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/OpenStudio-BuildStock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: Since there is no Plug Loads object in OpenStudio/EnergyPlus, we look for an ElectricEquipment object with the name that denotes it is residential plug loads. If one is found, it is replaced with the specified properties. Otherwise, a new such object is added to the model. Note: This measure requires the number of bedrooms/bathrooms to have already been assigned.

argument.name: option_type
argument.description: Inputs are used/ignored below based on the option type specified.

argument.name: energy_mult
argument.description: A multiplier on the national average energy use, which is calculated as: (1146.95 + 296.94 * Noccupants + 0.3 * FFA) for single-family detached, (1395.84 + 136.53 * Noccupants + 0.16 * FFA) for single-family attached, and (875.22 + 184.11 * Noccupants + 0.38 * FFA) for multifamily, where Noccupants is the number of occupants and FFA is the finished floor area in sqft.

argument.name: diversity_mult
argument.description: A diversity multiplier on the energy mutliplier.

argument.name: energy_use
argument.description: Annual energy use of the plug loads.

argument.name: sens_frac
argument.description: Fraction of internal gains that are sensible.

argument.name: lat_frac
argument.description: Fraction of internal gains that are latent.
